title: >>> COMBAT Evolved
body_text:
What a hard act to follow. Coming off the heels of literally, at least in terms of numbers, the largest dodgeball event ever. Three new records established; most female competition with 13, 15 brand new players, and 47 total players tip the attendance scale. On top of that, you have the highly successful captain in Joe Kelly who refuses to lose despite the stiff competition. If there is one event where the expectations couldn't be any higher, it would be DODGEBALL 42.
- - - - - - - - - - -
The Main Event: Joe Kelly defends against Lenny Herrera!
- - - - - - - - - - -
DODGEBALL 42 heads back to the birth place of Joe Kelly's four event undefeated streak as captain. Much like the weeks prior, he meets his match once again in "hot hands" catcher Lenny Herrera.
Lenny certainly played a major role at DODGEBALL 41. His many catches during the match, along with apparent catching partner Steve Adams, almost lead Derek Carty to defeat the mighty Kelly. As it is known however, the cards were in Joe's favor as his undefeated streak remained.
As the legendary wrestler Ric Flair once said, "To be the man, you got to beat the man." It was at the conclusion of 41 where Lenny respectfully challenged Joe to be his next opponent, in hopes to take the veteran down. The seeds have been planted for what could easily go down as the most memorable captains battle ever as the incredible Joe Kelly goes for an unprecendented fifth straight win as captain.
Can Lenny dethrone "The King of Captains"?
Or will Joe's reign of terror on the dodgeball world continue?
- - - - - - - - - - -
DODGEBALL 43: A Preview before the The Preview
- - - - - - - - - - -
As the weeks progress, it is often wondered who the next set of challengers will be to take on the captains champion. For all hopefulls, if you would like a shot at either Joe or Lenny at DODGEBALL 43 (whomever the champion may be), let yourself be heard! Both Derek and Lenny took the initiative and stepped up, wanting a crack at the reigning four-time champion.
If there are numerous challengers, then the champion can always make the choice.
- - - - - - - - - - -
DODGEBALL 43 Poster Contest
- - - - - - - - - - -
What do DODGEBALL 17, DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX, and DODGEBALL 29 have in common? Pretty easy question if you just read the sub-title; they had poster contests.
Much like Joe Kelly on the court, off the court two men have reigned supreme when it comes to creating the many colorful event posters. Justin Pierce won the inaugural contest with his movie poster for DODGEBALL 17 in mid-December 2005. Just a few weeks later, Dan Spengeman won the DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX contest with an impressive Valentine's Day design. The two then went one-on-one in the "Ultimate Poster Contest" for DODGEBALL 29, where Justin came out the victor.
The next of these fun contests is for the June 11th event, DODGEBALL 43. Posters should be in no later than June 5th. This will allow the contest to start immediately following DODGEBALL 42. You can enter as many posters as you'd like. Send in your designs to Undertaker13yrs@aol.com. Good luck to all!
Just a reminder, DODGEBALL 43 takes place at Ocean Road Park starting at 3pm.
- - - - - - - - - - -
Quick Schedule
- - - - - - - - - - -
DODGEBALL 43
Sunday, June 11th, 2006
Ocean Road Park at 3pm
DODGEBALL 44
Saturday, June 17th,2006
Wall High School at 6:30pm
DODGEBALL 45
Saturday, June 24th, 2006
Wall High School at 6:30pm
DODGEBALL 46
Friday, June 30th, 2006
Wall High School at 6:30pm
